Entries.default: This fragment of soul vibrates with a sense of deep worry and hesitation. As you draw closer, it drifts toward you with a sense of blind urgency.
You pant with exertion as you flee, clutching an ornate, golden ring in both hands. The hip-deep water slows your frenzied escape, but you persist with some tattered memory of hope.
A pained shriek rings out from the jungle. You turn back, distracted, and manage to run headlong into a towering form. The creature swivels her attention down at you.
She plucks you up with a bony talon as she would a doll. Through the haze of disorientation, you make out her pitted face and milk-white eyes.

Cackling, she snatches the golden ring and hangs it on the branch of a tall, gnarled tree. 

She tells you of the awful fate you'll suffer - feeding her grove, watering her children, but she makes it all sound like an honor.

You wish you could believe her.
The vision disperses in a cloud of pain and confusion.
Swinging her lantern softly, Xoti lures the soul into its depths.
